cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles SSE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn north-north-east Monday and accelerate toward Florida’s eastern Gulf Coast, then cross the peninsula and exit into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Big Bend area of Florida (near Cedar Key) with effects extending southward into Tampa Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – no U.S. watches yet, only Yucatan & Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A – no U.S. warnings yet, only Yucatan & Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from Naples northward through Tampa Bay to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (>=39 mph) possible by late Tuesday night; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the center tracks close enough to Tampa Bay
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–5 ft surge in Tampa Bay and adjacent coast as the cyclone approaches from the south
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated 10 inch totals could cause flash and urban flooding in the Tampa Bay area Tuesday night–Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands Tuesday night–Wednesday; dangerous marine conditions with very rough seas beginning late Tuesday
